objects.name: PAP
objects.description: This defines PAP as a STIX extension

objects.name: Okta Targeting Campaign / Figure Data Breach
objects.description: The group claimed responsibility for a data breach at fintech firm Figure, stealing 2.5GB of data after a social engineering attack on an employee, likely part of a broader campaign against Okta users.

objects.content:
Sector: Financial Services (Fintech)

Modus operandi:
Social engineering, employee phishing, extortion via dark web leak sites.

objects.name: Ukrainian Espionage 2026
objects.description: Referenced in relation to ongoing operations against Ukraine, using tools like WAVESIGN and INFAMOUSCHISEL to extract data from Signal and Telegram on Windows/Android devices.

objects.content:
Sector: Government, Defense, Energy

Modus operandi:
Mobile malware, messaging app database exfiltration, infrastructure hijacking.

objects.name: CVE-2026-2441
objects.description:
High-severity zero-day vulnerability (Use-after-free in CSS) being exploited in the wild to execute malicious code via compromised webpages.

Affected product: Chrome

Affected vendor: Google

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:google:chrome:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-1731
objects.description:
Critical pre-authentication remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in BeyondTrust products. Observed being reconned and exploited shortly after PoC release.

Affected product: Remote Support / Privileged Remote Access

Affected vendor: BeyondTrust

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:beyondtrust:remote_support:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2024-43468
objects.description:
Critical SQL injection vulnerability in SCCM allowing unauthenticated command execution. Added to CISA KEV.

Affected product: Microsoft Configuration Manager (SCCM)

Affected vendor: Microsoft

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:microsoft:configuration_manager:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: Breach: Odido
objects.description:
Massive data breach affecting 6.2 million customers of the Dutch phone giant.

Sector: Telecommunications

objects.name: Breach: Flickr
objects.description:
Data leak via a third-party email provider exposing usernames, emails, and IP addresses of subscribers, potentially facilitating large-scale phishing.

Sector: Technology / Social Media

objects.abstract: Geopolitical analysis (EN) / Economic Security and De-risking Strategy
objects.content:
Sector: European Union / China

Theme: Economic Security and De-risking Strategy

The EU is implementing a 'de-risking' strategy to reduce strategic dependencies on China, specifically in sectors like semiconductors (Chips Act), batteries, and critical raw materials, while filtering foreign direct investments (IDE).

Tags: De-risking, Economic Intelligence, Sovereignty

objects.name: CANFAIL Malware Campaign against Ukraine
objects.description:
A new undocumented group linked to Russian intelligence uses LLMs to generate social engineering lures and delivers the CANFAIL malware (obfuscated JavaScript) via Google Drive RAR archives.

Analysis:
The use of LLMs to overcome linguistic and technical barriers shows a professionalization of lower-tier state actors. The malware uses OAST-style callbacks for verification.

Recommendations:
- Block the specific PROSPERO OOO IP address (193.24.123.42) used for multi-vulnerability scanning.
- Alert cryptocurrency wallet users about physical mail phishing campaigns requesting recovery phrases.

objects.content: The threat landscape for mid-February 2026 is characterized by intense exploitation of critical vulnerabilities in enterprise management and remote access solutions (Ivanti, BeyondTrust, Microsoft SCCM). A single actor is notably responsible for 83% of Ivanti RCE attacks, signaling high automation. Concurrently, state-sponsored activity remains aggressive: Russian-linked groups are leveraging LLMs to enhance phishing campaigns in Ukraine, while Chinese actors targeted the Notepad++ update infrastructure for espionage. Finally, a creative shift in social engineering is observed with physical 'snail mail' letters targeting cryptocurrency wallet users (Trezor/Ledger), bypassing traditional digital filters.

objects.name: CTI Report (EN) - 2026-02-15
objects.description: Aggregated CTI report for language EN
